title: Chapter 1: Course Introduction
description: Overview of course, expectations, and introduction to data mining. Familiarize with course structure, policies, and software tools.

title: Chapter 2: Knowing Your Data - Part 1
description: Introduction to data exploration techniques, data visualization, normalization, and feature extraction. Prepare datasets for modeling; identify and handle missing values and outliers.

title: Chapter 3: Knowing Your Data - Part 2
description: Continuation of data exploration techniques focusing on the importance of data visualization and normalization.

title: Chapter 4: Supervised Learning Techniques - Logistic Regression
description: Introduction to logistic regression as a supervised learning algorithm, methods of implementation, and evaluation.

title: Chapter 5: Supervised Learning Techniques - Decision Trees
description: Exploration of decision trees, their structure, creation, and assessment as a data mining technique.

title: Chapter 6: Supervised Learning Techniques - Random Forest
description: Overview of the random forest algorithm, including its advantages and methods for implementation.

title: Chapter 7: Supervised Learning Techniques - Neural Networks
description: Introduction to neural networks, their architecture, training processes, and applications in data mining.

title: Chapter 8: Supervised Learning Techniques - Ensemble Learning Methods
description: Discussion on ensemble learning techniques, combining multiple models for improved accuracy and performance.

title: Chapter 9: Unsupervised Learning Techniques - Clustering
description: Examination of various clustering techniques and their application in organizing unlabelled data.

title: Chapter 10: Unsupervised Learning Techniques - Dimensionality Reduction
description: Introduction to methods for reducing the number of random variables under consideration, thus simplifying models while preserving essential information.

title: Chapter 11: Unsupervised Learning Techniques - Generative Models
description: Exploration of generative models that can generate new data instances based on learned data distribution.

title: Chapter 12: Advanced Topic - Text Mining
description: Techniques for representing text data and applying natural language processing methods to extract insights from unstructured data.

title: Chapter 13: Advanced Topic - Reinforcement Learning
description: Introduction to the principles of reinforcement learning, including its components and real-world applications.

title: Chapter 14: Final Project Presentations
description: Students will present their final projects, demonstrating their ability to communicate findings effectively to a varied audience.
